title: Design CLI Status Utility Architecture for War Rig Ticket Viewer
description:
Design the architecture for a CLI status utility that displays .war_rig_tickets.json state in real-time with in-place updates (like top/htop).

## Requirements
1. Accept ticket file path as command-line argument
2. Display ticket counts by type (documentation, validation, chrome, clarification)
3. Display ticket counts by state (created, in_progress, completed, blocked)
4. Show details of stuck/blocked tickets
5. Auto-refresh every few seconds (configurable interval)
6. In-place terminal updates (no scrolling output)

## Deliverables
- Architecture document with component design
- Data model for parsing .war_rig_tickets.json
- Terminal rendering strategy (curses, rich, or similar)
- Refresh mechanism design
- Error handling strategy for file access/parsing

## Technical Considerations
- Python 3.11+ compatibility
- Cross-platform terminal support (macOS, Linux)
- Memory-efficient handling of large ticket files
- Graceful handling of file changes during refresh
acceptance_criteria: Architecture document approved with clear component boundaries, data flow, and technology choices

title: Implement ticket-based orchestration engine
description:
Create war_rig/orchestration/ticket_engine.py:
- TicketOrchestrator class coordinating all workers
- Start: Program Manager creates tickets for all files
- Run: Scribe and Challenger pools process tickets in parallel
- Check: When all tickets closed, trigger Imperator review
- Cycle: If Imperator opens new tickets, restart pools
- Stop: Max cycles reached or Imperator satisfied
- Integration with existing LangGraph for per-file processing
- Progress reporting and metrics

title: Add metrics tracking for formatting errors
War Rig: Multi-Agent Mainframe Documentation System
description: Build War Rig, a multi-agent system for documenting legacy mainframe codebases (COBOL, PL/I, JCL). Uses Scribe (documenter), Challenger (validator), and Imperator (reviewer) agents with LangGraph orchestration. Final deliverable: documented AWS CardDemo sample mainframe code.
close_reason: All 21 child tasks completed - War Rig mainframe documentation system fully implemented

title: Project Scaffolding and Python Architecture
description:
Create the foundational project structure for War Rig. This task BLOCKS all other development work.

## Requirements:
- Python 3.11+ project structure with pyproject.toml
- Package layout: war_rig/ with subpackages for agents, models, preprocessing, orchestration, io, config
- LangGraph and Claude API dependencies configured
- pytest testing infrastructure
- Type hints throughout (mypy strict mode)
- Logging configuration
- CLI entry point structure

## Deliverables:
- /war_rig/__init__.py with version
- /war_rig/agents/ (empty __init__.py for scribe, challenger, imperator)
- /war_rig/models/ (empty __init__.py for data structures)
- /war_rig/preprocessing/ (for COBOL/JCL parsing)
- /war_rig/orchestration/ (for LangGraph workflows)
- /war_rig/io/ (file operations)
- /war_rig/config/ (configuration management)
- /tests/ directory structure mirroring source
- pyproject.toml with all dependencies
- .env.example for API keys
acceptance_criteria: Project can be installed with pip install -e . and pytest runs (even with no tests yet)

title: LangGraph Workflow Orchestration
description:
Implement the LangGraph workflow orchestrating the War Rig documentation process.

## Workflow States:
1. PREPROCESSING - Extract structural hints
2. SCRIBE_INITIAL - Scribe creates first draft
3. CHALLENGER_REVIEW - Challenger validates and questions
4. SCRIBE_RESPONSE - Scribe responds to questions
5. IMPERATOR_DECISION - Imperator decides next action
6. CHROME_PROCESSING - Handle Chrome tickets (loop back)
7. WITNESSED - Documentation approved
8. VALHALLA - Exceptional quality
9. FORCED - Max iterations reached

## State Transitions:
- PREPROCESSING -> SCRIBE_INITIAL
- SCRIBE_INITIAL -> CHALLENGER_REVIEW
- CHALLENGER_REVIEW -> SCRIBE_RESPONSE
- SCRIBE_RESPONSE -> IMPERATOR_DECISION
- IMPERATOR_DECISION -> WITNESSED | VALHALLA | CHROME_PROCESSING
- CHROME_PROCESSING -> SCRIBE_INITIAL (iteration++)
- iteration >= 3 -> FORCED (auto-approve)

## Graph State:
- source_code, file_type, preprocessor_output
- current_template, challenger_assessment
- scribe_responses, chrome_tickets
- iteration_count, final_status
- dialogue_history

## Checkpointing:
- Persist state after each node execution
- Resume capability from any checkpoint
- Failed programs logged for retry
acceptance_criteria: LangGraph workflow correctly orchestrates full documentation cycle for single program
close_reason: Full LangGraph workflow implemented with conditional edges and mock mode

title: File I/O and Output Generation
description:
Implement file I/O operations and output generation for War Rig.

## Input Operations:
- Read source files (COBOL, JCL, copybooks)
- Resolve copybook references (COPY statements)
- Load configuration files
- Resume from checkpoints

## Output Directory Structure:
output/
- analysis/ (inventory.json, cobol_structures.json, etc.)
- war_rig/iterations/ (per-iteration drafts)
- war_rig/chrome/ (Chrome tickets)
- war_rig/dialogues/ (Scribe-Challenger exchanges)
- valhalla/ (exceptional quality outputs)
- final/programs/ (JSON + Markdown documentation)
- final/copybooks/
- final/jcl/
- final/index.md (summary)
- metrics/ (iteration_counts, assessments, coverage)

## Output Formats:
- JSON: Machine-readable documentation
- Markdown: Human-readable documentation
- JSONL: For metrics and logging

## Features:
- Atomic writes (write to temp, then rename)
- Checkpoint frequency configurable (per_program default)
- Resume from any checkpoint
- Metrics collection and aggregation
acceptance_criteria: All output files written correctly, resume from checkpoint works, metrics collected accurately
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: Configuration Management System
description:
Implement configuration management for War Rig.

## War Rig Configuration (YAML):
war_rig:
  rig_id: 'ALPHA'
  scribe:
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514'
    temperature: 0.3
    max_tokens: 4000
  challenger:
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514'
    temperature: 0.5
    max_tokens: 2000
  imperator:
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514'
    temperature: 0.2
    max_tokens: 2000
  max_iterations: 3
  max_questions_per_round: 5
  max_chrome_tickets: 5

## System Configuration:
system:
  input_directory: './aws-mainframe-modernization-carddemo/app'
  output_directory: './output'
  checkpoint_frequency: 'per_program'
  preprocessing:
    extract_paragraphs: true
    extract_performs: true
    extract_calls: true
    extract_copybooks: true
    extract_sql: true
    extract_cics: true
  file_extensions:
    cobol: ['.cbl', '.cob', '.CBL', '.COB']
    copybook: ['.cpy', '.CPY', '.copy', '.COPY']
    jcl: ['.jcl', '.JCL']
    bms: ['.bms', '.BMS']

## Features:
- Pydantic Settings for validation
- Environment variable overrides (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, etc.)
- CLI argument overrides
- Config file loading (YAML)
- Sensible defaults
acceptance_criteria: Configuration loads from YAML, env vars, and CLI; validation catches invalid values
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

Comprehensive unit tests for all data models.

title: Unit Tests - Preprocessors
description:
Comprehensive unit tests for COBOL, JCL, and Copybook preprocessors.

## COBOL Preprocessor Tests:
- Division extraction (IDENTIFICATION, ENVIRONMENT, DATA, PROCEDURE)
- Paragraph identification and line ranges
- PERFORM statement parsing (simple, THRU, VARYING)
- CALL statement extraction with USING clause
- COPY statement detection
- SQL EXEC extraction (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE)
- CICS EXEC extraction (READ, WRITE, SEND, RECEIVE, LINK)
- File declaration parsing
- Continuation line handling
- Comment line handling (column 7 asterisk)
- Multi-line statement handling

## JCL Preprocessor Tests:
- JOB card parsing
- EXEC steps extraction (PGM=, PROC=)
- DD statement parsing (DSN=, DISP=, DCB=)
- In-stream data handling (DD *)
- Continuation line handling
- Comment handling (//*) 
- Symbolic parameter detection

## Copybook Preprocessor Tests:
- Level number hierarchy
- PIC clause parsing
- USAGE clause parsing (COMP, COMP-3)
- REDEFINES tracking
- OCCURS parsing (including DEPENDING ON)
- 88-level condition names
- FILLER handling
- VALUE clause extraction

## Test Data:
- Use AWS CardDemo sample files
- Create synthetic edge case files
acceptance_criteria: All preprocessor tests pass, edge cases handled, AWS CardDemo files parse correctly
close_reason: Full implementations with prompts created in scaffolding, tests passing

- VALHALLA decision for exceptional quality

- Chrome tickets properly formatted
- Acceptance criteria evaluation
- Scribe-Challenger convergence detection

## Mocking:
- Mock Claude API responses for deterministic testing
- Use recorded responses for integration tests
- Test timeout and error handling

title: DevOps Validation - Full Test Suite
description:
DevOps validation that all unit tests pass before proceeding to integration.

## Validation Steps:
1. Clone/pull latest code
2. Install dependencies (pip install -e .[dev])
3. Run full test suite (pytest -v --cov)
4. Verify coverage thresholds:
   - Models: 100%
   - Preprocessors: 95%+
   - Agents: 90%+
   - Orchestration: 90%+
   - I/O: 90%+
   - Overall: 90%+
5. Run mypy strict mode
6. Run linting (ruff/black)
7. Verify no security vulnerabilities (bandit)

## Success Criteria:
- All tests pass (0 failures)
- Coverage thresholds met
- No type errors
- No lint errors
- No security warnings (high/critical)

## Outputs:
- Test report (pytest-html)
- Coverage report (coverage.py)
- Type check report (mypy)
- Lint report (ruff)
- Security report (bandit)
acceptance_criteria: Full test suite passes with all quality gates met, reports generated

title: Core Data Models - Documentation Templates
description:
Implement Pydantic data models for documentation templates as specified in the War Rig spec.

## Models to implement:
1. DocumentationTemplate - Main program documentation structure
   - Header (program_id, file_name, file_type, analyzed_by, iteration_count, final_status)
   - Purpose (summary, business_context, program_type, citations)
   - Inputs/Outputs arrays with type enums
   - CalledPrograms, CallingContext, BusinessRules
   - DataFlow, CopybooksUsed, Paragraphs
   - ErrorHandling, SQLOperations, CICSOperations
   - OpenQuestions, ConfidenceAssessment

2. CopybookTemplate - For copybook documentation
   - Header, Purpose, RecordLayout, KeyFields, UsedBy

3. JCLTemplate - For JCL job documentation
   - Header, Purpose, Steps, DDStatements, Dependencies, RestartRecovery

## Enums:
- FileType: COBOL, PLI, JCL, COPYBOOK, PROC, BMS, OTHER
- ProgramType: BATCH, ONLINE_CICS, SUBROUTINE, UTILITY
- InputType, OutputType, CallType (as per spec)
- ConfidenceLevel: HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW
- FinalStatus: WITNESSED, FORCED, VALHALLA
acceptance_criteria: All models validate correctly, JSON serialization works, pytest tests pass for model validation
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: Core Data Models - Chrome Tickets and Agent Messages
description:
Implement Pydantic data models for agent communication as specified in the War Rig spec.

## Models to implement:
1. ChromeTicket - Issued by Imperator
   - ticket_id, program_id, section
   - issue_type: VAGUE, MISSING, CONTRADICTORY, UNCITED, INCOMPLETE, WRONG
   - description, guidance
   - priority: CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM

2. ChallengerQuestion
   - question_id, section
   - question_type: CLARIFICATION, VERIFICATION, COMPLETENESS, CHALLENGE
   - question, evidence (line numbers)
   - severity: BLOCKING, IMPORTANT, MINOR

3. ScribeResponse
   - question_id reference
   - response text
   - action_taken: UPDATED, DEFENDED, ACKNOWLEDGED
   - updated_section (if applicable)
   - citation

4. ImperatorDecision
   - decision: WITNESSED, CHROME, VALHALLA
   - chrome_tickets (if CHROME)
   - approved_documentation (if WITNESSED/VALHALLA)

5. ValidationAssessment
   - section, assessment: SOLID, SHAKY, WRONG
   - issues found, suggested corrections
acceptance_criteria: All models validate correctly, can serialize to/from JSON, pytest tests pass
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: COBOL Preprocessor - Structural Extraction
description:
Implement deterministic COBOL preprocessor (NO LLM) for structural extraction.

## Requirements:
- Parse COBOL source files to extract structural hints
- Must be purely deterministic - regex and parsing only
- Handle common COBOL variations (.cbl, .cob, .CBL, .COB)

## Outputs (PreprocessorOutput model):
- program_id: Extracted from PROGRAM-ID
- file_type: COBOL
- divisions: List of divisions found
- paragraphs: [{name, start_line, end_line}]
- performs: [{from_paragraph, to_paragraph, thru, line}]
- calls: [{program_name, using_params, line}]
- copybooks: [{name, line}] from COPY statements
- files: [{name, type (INDEXED/SEQUENTIAL/etc), line}]
- sql_statements: [{operation, table, line}] for EXEC SQL
- cics_commands: [{command, resource, line}] for EXEC CICS

## Edge cases:
- Multi-line statements (COBOL continuation)
- Comments (columns 1-6, column 7 asterisk)
- Mixed case handling
- Nested PERFORM structures
acceptance_criteria: Preprocessor correctly parses AWS CardDemo CBACT04C.cbl and produces valid PreprocessorOutput JSON
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: JCL Preprocessor - Structural Extraction
description:
Implement deterministic JCL preprocessor (NO LLM) for structural extraction.

## Requirements:
- Parse JCL source files to extract job structure
- Must be purely deterministic - regex and parsing only
- Handle common JCL extensions (.jcl, .JCL)

## Outputs (JCLPreprocessorOutput model):
- job_name: From JOB card
- file_type: JCL
- steps: [{name, program (PGM=), proc (PROC=), line}]
- dd_statements: [{step, dd_name, dataset (DSN=), line}]
- procs_called: List of procedure names
- datasets_referenced: All DSN= values extracted

## Edge cases:
- Continuation lines (non-blank in column 72)
- In-stream data (DD *)
- Symbolic parameters (&VAR)
- Comments (//*)
acceptance_criteria: Preprocessor correctly parses AWS CardDemo JCL samples and produces valid JCLPreprocessorOutput JSON
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: Copybook Preprocessor - Record Layout Extraction
description:
Implement deterministic Copybook preprocessor (NO LLM) for record layout extraction.

## Requirements:
- Parse COBOL copybook files to extract data structure definitions
- Must be purely deterministic - regex and parsing only
- Handle common copybook extensions (.cpy, .CPY, .copy, .COPY)

## Outputs (CopybookPreprocessorOutput model):
- copybook_name: From filename or 01 level name
- file_type: COPYBOOK
- record_layouts: [{level, field_name, picture, usage, redefines, occurs, line}]
- level hierarchy preservation
- REDEFINES chain tracking
- OCCURS DEPENDING ON extraction

## Edge cases:
- Nested levels (01, 05, 10, 15, etc.)
- COMP, COMP-3, PACKED-DECIMAL usage
- 88-level condition names
- FILLER fields
- Value clauses
- Continuation across lines
acceptance_criteria: Preprocessor correctly parses AWS CardDemo copybooks (CVACT01Y.cpy, CVACT02Y.cpy) and produces valid output
close_reason: Implemented as part of scaffolding with full working code

title: Scribe Agent Implementation
description:
Implement the Scribe (Documenter War Boy) agent using Claude API.

## Purpose:
Analyze mainframe source code and fill out the documentation template.

## Inputs:
- Source file content (COBOL, PL/I, JCL, or copybook)
- File type classification
- Structural hints from preprocessor
- Open Chrome tickets from previous iterations
- Copybook contents (resolved if referenced)
- Challenger questions from previous round

## Outputs:
- Completed documentation template (DocumentationTemplate model)
- Confidence level (HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW) per section
- Open questions list
- Responses to Challenger questions (ScribeResponse model)

## Behavior:
- First pass: Analyze code, fill template completely
- Subsequent passes: Address Chrome tickets and Challenger questions
- MUST cite line numbers for every factual claim
- MUST NOT invent information - mark unknowns as UNKNOWN
- Complete template even if sections are UNKNOWN

## Implementation:
- Use Claude claude-sonnet-4-20250514 (temperature 0.3, max_tokens 4000)
- Structured output using tool_use for template filling
- Prompt engineering for accurate citation extraction
- State management for multi-iteration conversations
acceptance_criteria: Scribe produces valid DocumentationTemplate from AWS CardDemo CBACT04C.cbl with accurate line citations
close_reason: Full implementations with prompts created in scaffolding, tests passing

title: Challenger Agent Implementation
description:
Implement the Challenger (Validator War Boy) agent using Claude API.

## Purpose:
Review Scribe's documentation, ask probing questions, identify gaps or errors.

## Inputs:
- Scribe's completed template
- Original source file content
- Structural hints from preprocessor
- Previous round questions and Scribe responses

## Outputs:
- List of questions for Scribe (ChallengerQuestion model, max 5 per round)
- List of potential issues found
- Validation assessment: SOLID, SHAKY, or WRONG per section
- Suggested corrections with citations

## Question Types:
- CLARIFICATION: 'What do you mean by X?'
- VERIFICATION: 'Line 234 says Y, but you documented Z'
- COMPLETENESS: 'What about error handling at line 456?'
- CHALLENGE: 'Are you sure this is an input, not output?'

## Constraints:
- Maximum 5 questions per round
- MUST provide evidence (line numbers) for challenges
- CANNOT modify documentation directly

## Implementation:
- Use Claude claude-sonnet-4-20250514 (temperature 0.5, max_tokens 2000)
- Cross-reference claims against source code
- Verify citation accuracy
- Identify contradictions between sections
acceptance_criteria: Challenger produces valid validation assessment for Scribe output, catches intentional errors in test cases
close_reason: Full implementations with prompts created in scaffolding, tests passing

title: Imperator Agent Implementation
description:
Implement the Imperator (Reviewer) agent using Claude API.

## Purpose:
Oversee the War Boy pair, decide when documentation is complete, issue Chrome tickets.

## Inputs:
- Current documentation draft
- Challenger's assessment
- Scribe's responses to questions
- Original source file content
- Iteration count

## Outputs:
- Decision: WITNESSED (approved), CHROME (needs work), or VALHALLA (exceptional)
- If CHROME: List of tickets (ChromeTicket model)
- If WITNESSED/VALHALLA: Final approved documentation

## Acceptance Criteria for Approval:
- Purpose section: Specific, not generic boilerplate
- All inputs and outputs identified
- At least one business rule documented with citation
- Copybooks listed match structural hints
- Challenger assessment is SOLID on critical sections
- No unresolved WRONG assessments

## Constraints:
- Maximum 3 iterations before forced approval
- Can override Challenger if evidence supports Scribe
- Must approve after max iterations (with quality flag: FORCED)

## Implementation:
- Use Claude claude-sonnet-4-20250514 (temperature 0.2, max_tokens 2000)
- Evaluate Scribe-Challenger convergence
- Identify issues the pair missed
- Decide when further iteration unlikely to improve quality
acceptance_criteria: Imperator correctly approves valid documentation and issues Chrome tickets for incomplete work
close_reason: Full implementations with prompts created in scaffolding, tests passing

title: [EPIC] Implement Cycle Limits for Challenger and Imperator
Implement CLI Status Utility for War Rig Ticket Viewer
description:
Implement the CLI status utility based on the architecture design for displaying .war_rig_tickets.json state in real-time.

## Requirements
1. Command-line interface accepting ticket file path as argument
2. Dashboard display showing:
   - Ticket counts by type (documentation, validation, chrome, clarification)
   - Ticket counts by state (created, in_progress, completed, blocked)
   - List of stuck/blocked tickets with details
3. In-place terminal updates (like top/htop) - no scrolling
4. Auto-refresh every N seconds (default: 3 seconds, configurable)
5. Clean exit handling (Ctrl+C)

## Implementation Tasks
- [ ] Parse command-line arguments (argparse)
- [ ] JSON file parser for .war_rig_tickets.json format
- [ ] Terminal UI with in-place updates (curses or rich library)
- [ ] Status aggregation and counting logic
- [ ] Blocked ticket detection and display
- [ ] Refresh loop with configurable interval
- [ ] Error handling for missing/corrupt files

## Technical Specs
- Python 3.11+
- Use architecture from war_rig-4ayn
- Modular design for testability
- Type hints throughout
- Docstrings for public APIs
acceptance_criteria: Functional CLI tool that reads ticket file and displays real-time status with in-place updates

title: Design ticket-based parallel workflow architecture
description:
Design the architecture for ticket-based parallel processing:
- Program Manager opens tickets for all source files at start
- Multiple Scribes (default 3) pick available tickets in parallel
- Multiple Challengers (default 2) pick Scribe-completed tickets
- Imperator reviews holistically when all tickets closed
- Define ticket states and transitions
- Define dependency relationships between ticket types
- Design termination conditions (max iterations or Imperator satisfied)
close_reason: Architecture design document created at docs/program_manager_architecture.md

- Allow graceful interruption and resume
- Save intermediate state for crash recovery

title: Design Super-Scribe Rescue Mode Architecture
description:
Design the architecture for Super-Scribe Rescue Mode feature.

## Overview
Add a --rescue-blocked flag to run_carddemo.py that creates a small pool of Opus-powered workers (1-2) to process only BLOCKED tickets and update ticket state on success.

## Design Requirements
- Define how --rescue-blocked flag integrates with existing CLI
- Design worker pool management (1-2 Opus workers)
- Specify BLOCKED ticket detection mechanism
- Define state update flow on successful rescue
- Consider error handling and retry logic
- Document integration points with existing ticket system

## Deliverables
- Architecture document with diagrams
- API/interface specifications
- Integration plan with run_carddemo.py

- States: open, claimed, scribe_complete, challenger_complete, closed
- Metadata: file_name, program_id, cycle_number, worker_id, parent_ticket_id
- Dependencies: CHALLENGER_REVIEW depends on SOURCE_DOC completion
